content: Hey I wanted to add a scaling animation to the dropdowns to sort of ornament them a bit. What do you guys think? https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10321399/31462041-18539b22-ae80-11e7-9ef6-f3526aad0986.gif
I'd love if it a few folks checked out the PR (#6953) and played with it; I think the animation is fast enough to not delay interaction, but that's something we should verify carefully :)
I loved the way dropbox used to do this, which is that the tooltip would show immediately, and then drop down a few pixels, if that makes sense?

I think it's important to keep these types of animations snappy. It's almost too ornamental if it takes any user time. I agree with @Rishi Gupta The way Paper does the tooltip and then a mini animation is helpful. Here's a slightly janky recording of what I'm talking about. DB_animation.mov
@Brock Whittaker what are your thoughts on this given the feedback?
keep in mind the speed is the same as the current animation.

I would definitely prefer faster than the current animation; I thought it was the current speed due to perf :).
Also maybe we should just have no animation when accessing the popover due to i?
